ai.question: Which of the following statements are true regarding routing protocols that use the link-state routing algorithm? (Choose three.)

choice.text: They are known collectively as SPF protocols.
They learn routes and send them to directly connected neighbors.
They maintain a complex database of the network topology.
They are based on the Dijkstra algorithm.
They are considered a good choice for small networks with low-end routers.

ai.question: What reasons would a network administrator have for using loopback interfaces when configuring OSPF? (Choose two.)

choice.text: Loopbacks are logical interfaces and do not go down.
Only loopback addresses can be used for an OSPF router ID.
Loopback interfaces are used to set OSPF metric.
The loopback address will be used as the router ID, overriding the local IP address values.
OSPF error checking is enabled by loopback addresses.
The loopback address will override the configured router priority value.

ai.question: In which of the following types of networks will OSPF designated routers not be elected? (Choose two.)
A network administrator enters the router ospf 100 command. What is the function of the number 100 in this command?
On a router running OSPF, what is the purpose of entering the bandwidth 56 command on a serial interface?

choice.text: changes the throughput of the interface to 56kbps
is necessary for the DUAL algorithm

ai.question: What factor does Cisco's implementation of OSPF use to pick the best route?
Which command will allow a router to advertise default static routes via OSPF?

choice.text: Default routes are local only and cannot be advertised using OSPF.

ai.question: During an OSPF DR/BDR election, what is used to determine the DR or BDR when participating OSPF routers have identical interface priorities?
Which packet type is invalid for OSPF?
